channel.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
channel.description:
http://www.kentonline.co.uk/kentonline/news/2012/june/14/biker_dies.aspx
A young motorcyclist has died after crashing into a lamp post. The 24-year-old was pronounced dead at the scene, on the A228 at High Halstow, at about 3.30pm yesterday. The biker, from the Dartford area, was travelling in the Rochester direction when the smash happened. No other vehicles were involved. His bike, a Suzuki, is said have hit a kerb and left the road in Sharnal Street. The rider collided with the post. Kent Police closed the road from Brittannia Street to Christmas Lane for more than five hours while they carried out investigations. Witnesses are asked to phone 01622 798538.
Predicted poles where he died: http://goo.gl/maps/60rN http://goo.gl/maps/C9gF

item.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Watching that video I’d say someones skull would probably cave from that impact, at the very least fracture badly, and although I can’t guarantee that wearing a helmet would prevent an injury from that kind of impact, I sure as hell would prefer to wear it

Still, how relevant is that to motorcycle injuries? Not sure about you Mopman, but everytime I’ve hit the earth it hasn’t just been in a straight downward style…

That’s why different helmets are made for different sports, a Downhill helmet is very different to a motocross helmet, and a motocross helmet is very different to a road bike helmet.

Noone ever claimed wearing a helmet would prevent you from every head injury. But that’s like saying… well, I won’t wear a helmet because it might injure my neck.

My opinion is; if you don’t want to risk a head injury, don’t ride a motorcycle. And if you do ride a motorcycle and choose not to wear a helmet, then it’s only a matter of time.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Or to put it another way:

item.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:34, topic:445132”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=547821.msg4131609#msg4131609 date=1351160941]

Im saying it wasn’t build to be hit directly

They’re built to withstand hits no matter what the impact is.
[/quote]
Orly?

:|[/quote]
Yes, they actually are. A motorcycle helmet has 3 layers, a harder outer shell layer, a softer, inner layer, and a padded layer.

They work by the hard shell outer layer absorbing and spreading the force over the impacted area, which is why generally when you have a bad crash you will notice your helmet will ‘crack’ or split. The outer shell’s only job, (other than to be painted nicely for da chickz), is to spread residual kinetic energy over a larger area.

The softer inner shell works to absorb and decelerate the head to try and soak up what energy has gone through the shell.

And the padded layer is there to secure the helmet, comfortably and securely. Basic helmet safety laws (ones that are the very basic of basic, helmet laws that aren’t cleared for competition for that matter, have a bare minimum of 400g.

New helmet technology is also emerging rapidly. Look at the new brand 6D, that I am luckily enough to have their equipment support. They use a ‘suspension’ in their helmet shells.

So you saying that a helmet is only there to prevent glancing blows, is very very very stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Frell:

Theyre about as useful as military helmets, theyre only there to stop glancing blows that would otherwise kill you.

Without a helmet 90% of motorcycle crashes would be fatal. No matter whether they stop instantaneous blows or not, they still save lives and for that every single motorcycle rider should be grateful for them. If a rider doesn’t wear the correct protective gear that’s offered to him or her then they need to wake up and get a grip of themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frell:

Theyre about as useful as military helmets, theyre only there to stop glancing blows that would otherwise kill you.

or if you live in a sane country where wearing a helmet is mandatory, and said helmet must meet a minimum safety standard, a motorcycle helmet can and likely will prevent any serious injury where not wearing a helmet would have resulted in a serious injury

of course shit happens, you can have the best gear and still die doing 40mph, that’s the price everyone who doesn’t have a cage surrounding them pays

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
item.dc:creator: @Phillipe Phillipé
item.description:
@Phillipe wrote:

Since this topic is now apparently about people telling stories about biker deaths.

I was overtaken by someone doing over 100mph just before a roundabout, he couldn’t slow down enough to make the turn and went head first through a sign post that was around 7ft long or so. He is now dead after being able to knock the sign over and force it to wrap around his body.

I’ve always had mad props for people who’re gutsy enough to drive bikes, I’ve ridden but nothing special - I couldn’t do what he’s shown doing, nor with one eye. Shame he died, atleast he did it doing something he enjoyed though. RIP.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P. Kryptix
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

Rest in peace man.

Most of us didn’t know you in real life but virtually you were a great person, the RSC man
That was the only RSC server I ever played. Thanks for everything man. Prayers are with your family.

Read full topic
